number of helpful: 84 of 91 people (92%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 9, 2013
												This is an incredibly low budget time travel FPS game. If you're looking for polished setpieces, you won't find them here. But if you're looking for using cluster bombs on civil war battlefields to mess with history, this is your game. One mission (sorry for the mild spoiler here, but it'll help sell you on the game) involves you getting put in a POW camp, being broken out by a mysterious stranger... and then traveling back in time and being the mysterious strange who breaks yourself out of the POW camp. It's so absurd, but it's awesome. The part where future soldiers with automatic weapons show up at the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius is totally campy. The one rule of the game is that you can't mess with history... until the game tells you to mess with history.If you're in the mood for something that's very clunky with a lot of heart, I think you'll enjoy making your way through the game. It's a pity that surface-level complaints about the game caused reviews to miss how enjoyable it is.

number of helpful: 43 of 61 people (70%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												*UPDATE*I finally managed to launch the game with my new gaming laptop since it has NVidia graphic card. The game is surprisingly made really well and I love it! So I decided to remove completely my old review and write a brand new one, a simple pros and cons.Pros:+ Completely unique and cool storyline. I don't think any other game has ever thought about stories like this. This kind of story has been my dream for a pretty long time and I never thought someone actually made a game like this+ Chosen war era is very unique. Other game developers rarely make any games about World War I, Civil War, and the American Indian war, since I know most people will hate sitting on trenches waiting for a head to pop up or having to reload for a long time after every shot while their enemies can hide in trees with bows. But I love it because it is different.+ Great storyline, not epic but it is really cool and people would be able to make a movie out of this game.+ Mediocre, but still acceptable graphics. Not much to expect from an old low-budget game. But it is still acceptable for me and I think it is pretty good.+ Challenging gameplay. Just don't play on the easiest difficulty. With increased difficulty you will receive more damage and it will feel much more tense. Imagine having to reload your musket with the enemy charging you with bayonets. + You can use modern assault rifle in civil war era. That's fun LOL.Cons:- Cannot run on computers with AMD graphic cards- Laser weapons, all weapons has 100% accuracy when you aim down the sight and 100% damage on all range. But it has no multiplayer so I don't care about OP weapons- Abandoned by developers- Invisible walls- Bad voice acting- Character dialogues tend to overlap- Random crashes, but not too often- Terrible soundtrack. Almost no soundtracks in-game- No stealth element. Enemies will easily see you from far away and you get no silenced weapons. You will also move way too slow when you crouch.Overall, you will easily notice this game is pretty crude since I heard it is a low budget game. Square-ish no expression face, bad voice acting, bad animation, no melee animation, etc. But the storyline is very unique and the war era is really not like other FPS games. There may be other FPS Civil War/American-Indian War/World War 1 game out there like Verdun, but as far as I know, people rarely make games in this war era and it makes this game worth buying and playing. The campaign itself isn't too long and it's just like finishing CoD and Battlefield's single player campaign. But I really like this game for its unique storyline and war era. However, I decided not to change my recommendation status since I personally think this game is overpriced. Wait for a discount or something. It's not worth the price for its short campaign and little to nothing replay value.

number of helpful: 19 of 22 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												8/10I recommend this game highly. It is a great game for those interested in an FPS that goes to different points in history. Well, if you have an older Nvidia graphics card anyway. Running a GTX 970 the Physx features of this game wouldnt work, even with legacy drivers installed (fog, leaves, weapon smoke and other particles) - without these the game just isnt as good IMO. Therefore, i had to play on an old 9600GT to get PhysX working. Worse; It wouldnt run on my Radeon card at all. EDIT: Tested on Windows 10 Tech Preview 64bit. Its not the OS that's causing the issue for some people. You just need an older GPUTechnical problems aside, the actual game:PROS:- Fantastic idea - Travelling back to various periods including WW1 and the Civil war. These arent exactly common in other games and it was a refreshing change, and on the whole they did it well. They actually explain the time tavel part of it too, and the plot involves 2 opposing groups fighting to either preserve or change history.- Good levels - who doesnt want to form up in rank against the confederates at Antietam, or break out of a WW2 concentration camp?- Reload animation minigame - get it right and it speeds up the reload, get it wrong and it jams and takes longer. Great mechanic.- Weapon upgrade system- Fairly good voice acting, and chatter from other sodiers on the battlefield- Slight choice to pick the mission you want to do next- Feeling like a badass when you are wrecking Romans and Confederates with future weaponryCONS: - Maps arent as open as they appear, invisible walls and linear design- occassionally getting stuck to surfaces- A few turret sections that are only ok- you can bypass the necessity for reloading by switching to secondary and using it, by the time you go back to your primary weapon it has reloaded itself. This takes away from the feel of the game, especially in the civil war with muskets that should take a while to reload.- The ending leaves the game open a bit for a sequel thats likely never coming.In conclusion though, the negatives don't outweigh the positives for me and I think if you have an older nvidia card this game is definitely worth a shot. If you can get it working with PhysX the graphics hold up surprisingly well, and the game has a great concept and its a hell of a lot of fun.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2016
												"Darkest of Days"is a really neat ,great looking ,game with a splendid  array of  period  weapons.It's fun banging away with a realistic looking 1860 Colt 44 army or an accurately modelled "broom stick'' Mauser.There  is some very good,interesting hardware in this game and firing it is remarkably realistic for trajectories and ballistics.  10 out of 10 there....  How does it run? My PC is Win 7 64 bit with  Nvidia graphics  and it runs smoothly and looks much better than I expected.It looks really good. There have been no crashes,bugs,lockups.The acting is ok ,music fine , battles are wonderfully noisy  and confusing .Big Horn with Custer and the boys is a lot  of fun  plus the time travel to the  Russian front circa 1914  and the US civil  war  makes this a bit of a one of a kind. A very good game but do check to see  if your pc can run it.If it can  buy it now its never going to be cheaper...

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 23
												It is rare to see games with the effect of time traveling in them, when I found out about Darkest of Days and how you get to "time travel" in it, I was totally into getting it, and I did and it is awesome.The game follows the story of a man named Alexander Morris, a soldier in General Custer's army. The game begins with the Battle of Little Big Horn (or Custer's Last Stand) going down in the dumps when all of the sudden Morris is injured and rescued by a man in futuristic armor who appears out of a bubble like portal. In the game you are assigned to "Protect and Preserve History as it is" by traveling through time into events and famous battles of World War 1, World War 2 and the American Civil War, rescuing certain individuals that play a key role in history.The shooter and story aspect of this game is awesome, because you get to use different weapons from the American Civil War, WW1, and WW2. The graphics of this game...not the best and you can tell there are some glitches in it, it is like the producers of this game wanted to make it quickly, and the ending is a cliff hanger (hence the four star rating). But all in all Darkest of Days is an action filled first person shooter that is exciting and fun to play. It is long and can be difficult if you are not careful but I like the time traveling, Characters, Story, and weapons in it. (Just a side note, there is a lot of swearing and cussing in this game just to give you a heads up).But Darkest of Days is a fun game and it is great to see a game with time traveling in it, I would recommend this for any time traveling/shooter fan. :)

												This is actually OK, despite the really short campaign and the clunky animations. It runs well on my ♥♥♥♥♥♥ computer, and that surprised me. So, like I said, the campaign was short. Yes, it is only between 6-8 hours, but it's one of those campaigns where you keep playing it until you can beat the entire game on the hardest difficulty with no trouble at all. It's indeed good, but animations are clunky, the story was a bit generic, and there was SO much potential thrown out the window, and there is no multiplayer. So, overall, this game is a 6/10 in my book, meaning it's good to play for a while, but you will eventually stop playing it. It wasn't worth the 20 bucks I payed for it, but more like 10 bucks.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												EDIT: Let's put up some standards here shall we?Darkest of Days? What is this? Simple.A first Person shooter. BUT that is not all. You are able to experience various events.Even though only digging at the top, you are able to learn history (Atleast i did).Example: What do you think is the darkest day of american history? 9/11? Well wrong.The battle of Antietam in the american civil war.This game captures time traveling, altering history and history itself.You are about to be killed when a mysterious agent, give you "the choice" to save your life.Why did he choose you? You are a ghost of time. You arrived to early, your papers from your transport got lost. You don't exist according to documents. So it's not so obvious, if you are missing and recruited to maintain time.Timelines where you will go:American Civil war.First World war.Second World war.-Secret-Let's keep it that short, because you will love the complex story of the game itself, if you cope with it.MOVING ON TO THE PRO'S AND CONSPro's - Interesting concept of the ghosts of time (no records of them, did they even exist at all?) - Various assets of weapons (Modern ones, First World war weapons, etc.) - Actually nice sound quality - Nice capturing of history (What happend, when? etc.) - complex story - Seperate Targets (Some can die and don't change the history, some need to be saved) - unexpected turn of events at certain points This game actually reached my interest in history, especially in the history of america.Let's be specific, my interest in the civil war.And because of that bit of interest which i got from this game, i actually started to study history. Neutral This is a section where i put the points which i can't judge about what you guys would feel. - Graphics are a bit old, but easy to overlook when you are in a fight. - Voice acting is a bit harsh and the movement of the mouth is badly captured, but the voices themself are pretty to be honest. Cons  - You can get distracted on pretty easy ways. - Instructions of the levels are rarely explained through talking -> Frustration rises because you overlooked a hint or a way. - complex story (some people like it, like me, but many can't cope with it) - Same Missions (find a historicly relevant person, secure them, while shooting the enemy) - no multiplayerIf you have trouble deciding whether you buy this game, feel free to contact me, i try to answer your questions, the best i can.Thank you for reading this.GreetingsKörnäl

												Oh boy, Darkest of Days. You sure were quite the attention nabber at the presentations in the eyes of many only to fall flat on your♥♥♥♥♥on release. Darkest of Days got nothing but poor ratings across the board and, in my honest opinion, I have to disagree. Sure, the story and abrupt ending was incredibly idiotic, but the game itself isn't really all too bad. The campaign was of decent length and I had fun mowing down people in the Civil War era with a full automatic SMG. While DoD only stays in the WWI and Civil War times, it still has pretty cool mission design in some places. And I guarentee you will love the last level of the game but hate it because you wish there was more levels like it. However, I recommend Darkest of Days.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
												OK had this game on Xbox before buying it on PC.... I know, hate if you want... This game is glichty as all Hell, runs like crap and looks like crap. but for some reason i still love it. I dont know why, maybe its the feeling of mowing down civil war soldiers with a future machine gun, or burning poor Romans with a flamethrower. This game says its about time travel but you'll be spending most of your time in the Civil War and WW1 with a few missions outside of those. For a FPS this game has Alot of actors on screen at one time, ~300, and the moments where you're standing in close order drill in the civil war is just loads of fun. For me the WW1 era missions are really hit and miss and the 3 or 4 other missions in the game are great. The story overall is Meh. This game has its moments so ill recommend, but really look into it if you want to buy it. Id get it on a sale if you're unsure. Its a bad game, but for me a lovable one. Some parts are pure magic, others are that one zepplin mission.... Seriously.... ♥♥♥♥ YOU ZEP.

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												 At long last, I know what it would be like to go into War tomorrow if I were Robert Downey JR. As I watched dozens of German WW1 troops spawn in, arms upraised, and drop onto a hill before charging our position, I manned the automatic gun. Streams of brilliant gunfire shot wildly, yet shocking accurately onto my foes, but there was no way to stem the tide! The huns breached the trenches and began firing at the fleeing men around me... Yet to a man, every German troop was looking straight at me! They shot with unnerving pin point precision, but never tore they eyes from me. This, my friends, is the Robert Downey JR war simulator. Enemies spew over the mud and blood, but despite aiming their guns at enemies, they all stare right at you in slack mouthed awe! I could almost hear the Germans whispering: "Schauen Sie, Hände! Das ist Robert Downey JR! Nicht schießen, schauen Sie nur." as they elbowed their friends in the ribs softly, not interrupting their gunfire as they smiled at me. Okay, okay, so there's more to this game then that... Here's some things to like: I got to kill toga clad civilians fleeing the Mt Vesuvius eruption with a flame thrower. That was a big'ol plus. I turned the tide of the American Civil War by introducing them to the automatic weapon. The game didn't give me a tumor of any kind, so that's pretty cool. Here are some things that weren't great: "Mother"'s voice actor sounds like she's reading the news and weather. The levels, despite SEEMING to be large, open maps are, in reality, a series of straight lines with knee high fences keeping you from moving around enemy positions. The programming is a bit lack luster... For example, you can star reloading one weapon and switch to using another while it continues to reload on its own. This includes powder rifles that require powder, wadding, bullet and sabot all to be pounded down with a loading pole while your... Um... Other set of arms shoots your pistol? Stairs are sometimes only surmountable by jumping up them, which doesn't sound too bad, but when you're running backwards up them as you shoot at suicidal enemies that charge towards you and you suddenly stop in the open, letting round after round puncture your precious organs... Then you'll long for the days when stairs could be programmed correctly. Don't worry, though, your enemies have the same problem. Sadly, their solution is to phase halfway through the stairs themselves with only the tops of their heads showing and shower you in gunfire while they remain mostly unharmed by all but the luckiest attacks. In short, while being a time traveling Robert Downey JR, shooting Roman legionnaires with a machine gun SOUNDS awesome, you could instead take the $20 US asking price for this game, buy Iron Man and 300 on blu-ray, record footage from each and splice them together and watch that instead. ... Please leave a reply to this review with a link to the result if you've done that...

content:
Posted: January 6, 2014
												Once again, it's a cool game concept. Travelling through time, the possibility of playing through different eras of history and even pre-history, while occasionally bringing in weapons from a different time period to help you out, all within a first-person shooter seems like it would be hard to screw up.HOWEVER. This game doesn't capitalize enough on its own ideas. For example, in total there are only four points in history you visit: The American Civil War, both World Wars, and Pompeii at the end. Why can't we go visit the Roman Empire? Or see the Peloponnesian Wars? Hell, why not go investigate Ancient Egypt? Or if you really want to go nuts, take the player back to pre-historic times, like the Jurassic era. Running away from a T-Rex because you're armed with nothing but a tree branch and some rocks could make for an interesting chase sequence!On top of that, I noticed that a lot of the time, NPCs kept walking straight through walls, sometimes even getting stuck in them. Another time, an enemy was actually shooting me through a ROCK. And if THAT weren't enough, the game ends on a friggin' cliffhanger that is highly unlikely to ever be resolved, because I doubt the developers (if they're even still around) are going to release a sequel. Overall, it's a mediocre title that could have been fantastic, had they simply gave it a bit more effort and imagination.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												My take on the Game+ explores two eras that have been left behind in the gaming industry (US civil war and World War One)+ gun upgrade system related to ingame performance (and guns change visually to some upgrades)+ good maps (very open; much happens in multiple areas and sidepaths which allows for some replayability, ...)+ NPC's use languages according to nationality (German NPC soldiers in ww1 speak german most of the time, ...)+ graphics were good for their time- story leaves you with quite a cliffhanger yet no sequel can be expected- characters are sometimes dull- NPC's, like in many other games, spam 'battle cries'- even though NPC's use the language according to their nationality the translations and voices themselves are frankly poorly made (german NPC soldiers in ww1 sometimes speak like some english dude tried to speak german or something that isn't even german, ...)- AI is sometimes not all that intelligent- logical errors (you change history yet people from the future somehow still remember how history was supposed to go down, ...)- only story- and some kind of skirmish-mode---------------------------------------------In Deutsch:Was ich vom Game halte:+ Erkundet zwei Ären welche von der Spieleindustrie vernachlässigt werden (den US Bürgerkrieg und den Ersten Weltkrieg)+ Waffenupgradesystem verbunden mit der Performance des Spielers (ebenfalls verändern sich die Waffen nach einigen Upgrades visuell)+ Gute Karten (sehr offen, vieles passiert in mehreren Arealen und Alternativrouten was etwas Wiederspielwert gibt, ...)+ NPC's benutzen die Sprache ihres Landes (Deutsche NPC im Ersten Weltkrieg reden meistens Deutsch, ...)+ Graphik war gut für ihre Zeit- Die Geschichte lässt einen mit einem Cliffhanger zurück und es kann kein zweiter Teil erwartet werden- Charaktere sind manchmal langweilig- NPC's spammen Schlachtrufe wieder und wieder- Auch wenn die NPC Wahrheitsgetreue Sprachen sprechen sind die Übersetzungen und Stimmen selber manchmal einfach nur schlecht (Deutsche Soldaten im Ersten Weltkrieg sprechen manchmal so, als ob ein Engländer Deutsch zu sprechen versuchte oder sogar etwas, das nicht einmal Deutsch ist, ...)- Die AI ist manchmal nicht ganz helle- Logische Fehler (Man verändert die Geschichte aber die Leute aus der Zukunft scheinen die Geschichte noch immer so zu kennen wie sie eigentlich ablief, ...)- nur Story- und Plänkelei-Modus

												Been wanting to play this game since it came out. Glad I did. :D+Pretty interesting story.+Great level design.+A fair amount of weapons, some of which are really awesome.+Good progressive challenge level. Halfway through the game I had to crank it down from medium to easy.+Graphics are good for their age.+Can fight endless swarms of Nazis.+Can replay any mission later with any selection of weapons you've unlocked.-Really short, but this could have been to keep the game from dragging on.-Oldschool shooter mechanics. No leaning or prone, for example.-No multiplayerAll in all, pretty good! I recommend it, especially on sale. You're only paying for 8 hours of gameplay, and that's if you die a lot like I did, so keep that in mind.Only thing that would have made the game better is if it had TimeShift's time manipulation gameplay features. But regardless, great job, devs. :) This game is just as awesome as I'd hoped it would be.8/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												Before I begin, there are mild spoilers about the various settings you visit in this game, if that bothers you don't read this review.What can I say about Darkest of Days? It has been quite some time since I've last played this title and sadly, I may never get a chance to play it again (more on why exactly later). My regret at not being able to play again and my recommendation should be enough to indicate that I enjoyed this, but let me tell you why.Darkest of Days is not a AAA title, it lacks polish and was clearly not developed with a large budget. It reminds me of a girl that you find enchanting and even sexy despite a plain apperance, because she has that certain "something" you like in the opposite sex, she has quirks in all the right ways, that allow you to overlook or even like any flaws she has. Darkest of Days was that sort of game for me. It has bugs, it's actually kind of ugly (even when it came out), the premise of the story is amazing, but the execution isn't very good. The main character is a faceless man rescued from certain death from the scene of Custer's last stand, whisked away time agents and put under the wing of the forgettable and strange Dexter. You are then thrown in various historical periods to prevent changes to the timeline, it follows a somewhat predictable but not entirely boring temporal civil war-like paradigm.So far it sounds like I hate this game, but I don't, as I've said I like it. Why? I'm a history buff. The sheer gratitious pleasure of wielding a futuristic automatic weapon against American Civil War era soldiers, Roman Legionaries, and World War 1 era German soldiers was enough to sell me on the game alone. While the environments and situations are not as varied as you would think based on what I just said, it was enough to keep me interested and wanting to see what happens next. This novelty of concept alone was enough to make me like this game, if someone ever picks up this concept and does it better I may never want to play another first person shooter again. Also everything felt well done enough to not distract significantly from my enjoyment of the theme. By far the best segments of the game are the beginning sequences in the American Civil War and the end which takes place in the ancient world.Should you buy this? Well, that depends. Remember how I mentioned I can't play this anymore? Well, when I built my new PC I decided to go with an AMD GPU, Darkest of Days does not function without an NVIDIA GPU and to my knowledge (and last I checked) there is no work around for this and the development house that created this game no longer exists so a solution is unlikely ever to be forthcoming. The other factor you have to consider is: does anything I mentioned to you sound like it would be as interesting to you as it was to me? Remember, this isn't your Call of Duty or Battlefield. It's a somewhat mediocre offering from a small studio that collapsed. What it does have is an interesting concept, it has little else going for it. If you like the concept and you can actually run it, I suggest this highly as a short diversion. If not, stay away.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												Darkest of days is a game worthy for history fans. There's one problem: it's too short. The game has a huge potential, but it has bugs and often crash especially graphics as well. The plot is trying to be cool, but feels like a Sci-Fi B movie at best. The ending was like weak to say. I must address the pro and cons of the game.Pro: the actual historical weapons are accurate. Imagine reloading a rifle musket is long and tedious. If you planned to use it in close range, use its range since its rifling barrel gives huge advantage. I recommend use the rifle musket in long range. WWI weapons are authentic to say which its very impressive that the developers understood the weapons of the time. What's great to experience some of historical moments in Civil War to WWI, but I will not spoil it.  Con: the story felt weak, graphical issues, and wasted potential. They could done a better job explaining, but they assume time travel as if it was Back to the Future. I would like to see Time Travel fit with Multiverse theory where altered timeline interact with original time. This is like as if it was a Terminator's version done badly. The graphics are another problem; if you don't have Nvida, don't buy this game. But if you have Nvida even a good one, it will crash for no good reason. My laptop can run Attila total war without any problems, but this game will continuous crash. The AI is the worse and sometime use an aiming bot as if out of nowhere.The AI are like brain dead and always focus on you instead of other enemies. The game is flawed in the content and the ending is a sequel bait which they were about to make a franchise out of it. Conclusion: I do enjoy the game. Not perfect, but I would play it once and awhile. This game is a guilty pleasure and might do a Let's Play series. My rating on this game based on enjoyment, criticism, and idea is 5/10. It has flaws which many will not enjoy, graphical issues, weak spiked difficulty AI, and weak story. However, I like this potential idea where I wish some one will remake this game or a better than first one sequel, historical events, and using historical firearms.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												My take on the Game+ explores two eras that have been left behind in the gaming industry (US civil war and World War One)+ gun upgrade system related to ingame performance (and guns change visually to some upgrades)+ good maps (very open; much happens in multiple areas and sidepaths which allows for some replayability, ...)+ NPC's use languages according to nationality (German NPC soldiers in ww1 speak german most of the time, ...)+ graphics were good for their time- story leaves you with quite a cliffhanger yet no sequel can be expected- characters are sometimes dull- NPC's, like in many other games, spam 'battle cries'- even though NPC's use the language according to their nationality the translations and voices themselves are frankly poorly made (german NPC soldiers in ww1 sometimes speak like some english dude tried to speak german or something that isn't even german, ...)- AI is sometimes not all that intelligent- logical errors (you change history yet people from the future somehow still remember how history was supposed to go down, ...)- only story- and some kind of skirmish-mode---------------------------------------------In Deutsch:Was ich vom Game halte:+ Erkundet zwei Ären welche von der Spieleindustrie vernachlässigt werden (den US Bürgerkrieg und den Ersten Weltkrieg)+ Waffenupgradesystem verbunden mit der Performance des Spielers (ebenfalls verändern sich die Waffen nach einigen Upgrades visuell)+ Gute Karten (sehr offen, vieles passiert in mehreren Arealen und Alternativrouten was etwas Wiederspielwert gibt, ...)+ NPC's benutzen die Sprache ihres Landes (Deutsche NPC im Ersten Weltkrieg reden meistens Deutsch, ...)+ Graphik war gut für ihre Zeit- Die Geschichte lässt einen mit einem Cliffhanger zurück und es kann kein zweiter Teil erwartet werden- Charaktere sind manchmal langweilig- NPC's spammen Schlachtrufe wieder und wieder- Auch wenn die NPC Wahrheitsgetreue Sprachen sprechen sind die Übersetzungen und Stimmen selber manchmal einfach nur schlecht (Deutsche Soldaten im Ersten Weltkrieg sprechen manchmal so, als ob ein Engländer Deutsch zu sprechen versuchte oder sogar etwas, das nicht einmal Deutsch ist, ...)- Die AI ist manchmal nicht ganz helle- Logische Fehler (Man verändert die Geschichte aber die Leute aus der Zukunft scheinen die Geschichte noch immer so zu kennen wie sie eigentlich ablief, ...)- nur Story- und Plänkelei-Modus

												There are many things that might go through your head about spending $20 on this game. I'm going to tell you that it's not worth buying it when it's not on sale. It's a fun game, totally awesome concept, and I love the setting for the game. However the AI is absolutely laughable, there's no difficulty to the game if you don't turn up the difficulty to the highest setting. But then it can be too difficult beacuse enemies will walk behind you and not get shot by the allies on your side, they will watch the enemy stand in front of them and shoot at you. Even if there are like 20 of them.

Posted: February 9, 2016
												This game may be buggy but its hell of a alot of fun to blast through. The concept alone is enough to keep you playing just to see how crazy the game gets.If you like history and single player only first person shooter story driven games I definately recommend this. The only thing this game is missing is high quality production values.The A.I. appear in vast numbers but are really dumb, characters look like clones and glitch through scenery whilst the games campaign lasts around 8 hours. In short its a budget game made special by its original concept.If any shooter deserves a high quality well made sequel or spiritual successor its Darkest of Days.... We can only hope.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												Darkest of days is a game worthy for history fans. There's one problem: it's too short. The game has a huge potential, but it has bugs and often crash especially graphics as well. The plot is trying to be cool, but feels like a Sci-Fi B movie at best. The ending was like weak to say. I must address the pro and cons of the game.Pro: the actual historical weapons are accurate. Imagine reloading a rifle musket is long and tedious. If you planned to use it in close range, use its range since its rifling barrel gives huge advantage. I recommend use the rifle musket in long range. WWI weapons are authentic to say which its very impressive that the developers understood the weapons of the time. What's great to experience some of historical moments in Civil War to WWI, but I will not spoil it.  Con: the story felt weak, graphical issues, and wasted potential. They could done a better job explaining, but they assume time travel as if it was Back to the Future. I would like to see Time Travel fit with Multiverse theory where altered timeline interact with original time. This is like as if it was a Terminator's version done badly. The graphics are another problem; if you don't have Nvida, don't buy this game. But if you have Nvida even a good one, it will crash for no good reason. My laptop can run Attila total war without any problems, but this game will continuous crash. The AI is the worse and sometime use an aiming bot as if out of nowhere.The AI are like brain dead and always focus on you instead of other enemies. The game is flawed in the content and the ending is a sequel bait which they were about to make a franchise out of it. Conclusion: I do enjoy the game. Not perfect, but I would play it once and awhile. This game is a guilty pleasure and might do a Let's Play series. My rating on this game based on enjoyment, criticism, and idea is 5/10. It has flaws which many will not enjoy, graphical issues, weak spiked difficulty AI, and weak story. However, I like this potential idea where I wish some one will remake this game or a better than first one sequel, historical events, and using historical firearms.
